meta_title: Why God is not pleased with us - YouTube
title: Why God is not pleased with us

body: People choose to not believe in God because if they did they have to stop doing the "sinful" stuff they want to do. I heard someone say even if God was real they wouldn't follow/believe in him. Why? Because they want to do whatever they want and not what God wants.
body_html: People choose to not believe in God because if they did they have to stop doing the "sinful" stuff they want to do. I heard someone say even if God was real they wouldn't follow/believe in him. Why? Because they want to do whatever they want and not what God wants.

post.meta_title: Why God is not pleased with us - YouTube
post.title: Why God is not pleased with us

body:
you can be good without god.  god is a generic name for something we don't understand and some of the names for god in Hebrew attest to this....the name is 'the unknowable'. The concept is similar to when Muslims prohibit showing images of god - humans tend to worship images and put to much focus on texts when all that is in the world could never ever fit in one book and so the book is a rough guide only.  There is another Hebrew name for god, I think , 'the unspeakable name'...and that is also similar to the concept of showing no image- because humans pretend like they know everything about god and try to say god wants this or that.  Sometimes what they say is close to truth, but other times they are conning people.
The god of the bible was a shithead and killed more people than satan or Lucifer and god supposedly created satan and lucifer.  the bible is a collection of stories written by many people and isn't to be taken as hard fact, but merely as a rough guide...things to deeply consider. same with other holy texts.
body_html: you can be good without god. god is a generic name for something we don't understand and some of the names for god in Hebrew attest to this....the name is 'the unknowable'. Sometimes what they say is close to truth, but other times they are conning people. The god of the bible was a shithead and killed more people than satan or Lucifer and god supposedly created satan and lucifer. the bible is a collection of stories written by many people and isn't to be taken as hard fact, but merely as a rough guide...things to deeply consider. same with other holy texts.

body: Some truth in what you said. I don't totally agree with you but that's okay. I don't focus on just the Bible but a lot of stuff I follow the Christian mystic route then the so called "normal" Christian if you want a label. So much we don't know about that they hide from us.

body: well, if there is any truth to the bilbe verse (that i kinda like) that the kingdom of god is within us), then we don't need to worry about what others are hiding, but what we each are hiding from ourselves. Getting rid of the noise and busyness in our lives may make more room (like clearing the air or space) for god to show itself to us.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: The reason is that the bible has been edited by scribes who often inserted pagan or demonic doctrines into it. Characters in the oldest bible stories do not seem to be aware of most of the Jewish laws, even the super-important ones. Much of the law books are fake, the brutal genocides probably weren't real, and a myriad of other stuff. God specifically calls out animal sacrifices and likely the laws saying to burn people alive when speaking to Jeremiah (Jeremiah 7). In the next chapter (8) he says: "How can you say 'we are wise, and the law of 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 is with us'? Because in reality the false pen of scribes has written to lie!". And there we have it. They did not have the law of God because they were instead following phony religious texts, many of which were forged completely and others which were factual accounts and heavily edited. Nevertheless, they should've known his real law in their heart (8:4-7). It's interesting to note that this prophecy occurs shortly after a very strange story in which Josiah's priests "find" a book of law in the temple. That's very odd to misplace such holy words so easily, or only have one copy of them. Especially when it was found to contain everything in support of Josiah's reforms just in time for him to implement them, and it conveniently depicts him ultra favorably and gives him more power.

Much of the law books are fake, the brutal genocides probably weren't real, and a myriad of other stuff. God specifically calls out animal sacrifices and likely the laws saying to burn people alive when speaking to Jeremiah (Jeremiah 7). In the next chapter (8) he says: "How can you say 'we are wise, and the law of 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 is with us'? Because in reality the false pen of scribes has written to lie!". And there we have it. They did not have the law of God because they were instead following phony religious texts, many of which were forged completely and others which were factual accounts and heavily edited. Nevertheless, they should've known his real law in their heart (8:4-7). It's interesting to note that this prophecy occurs shortly after a very strange story in which Josiah's priests "find" a book of law in the temple. That's very odd to misplace such holy words so easily, or only have one copy of them. Especially when it was found to contain everything in support of Josiah's reforms just in time for him to implement them, and it conveniently depicts him ultra favorably and gives him more power.
